page.title: 19Pudding Norton Hall Farm
page.content: This farm covers about 1.66 sq. Kms. of our block, and once included the land where Fakenham Racecourse and the Sports Centre now stand. This year the fields are mostly down to cereal crops (barley and wheat) and sugar beet. There is also a small acreage of grass for silage, and some rough grass for grazing. A small herd of cattle are kept but the Charolais bull was sent to market earlier this year. There are 3 small deciduous woods on the part of the farm in our block, and a row of trees lining the drive to the hall. There are 2 farm cottages and several barns and outbuildings. Near the farm buildings are the remains of Pudding Norton village and the ruins of St. Mary's Church. This area is grassed and no cultivation is allowed. There are 2 ponds near the farm buildings and 2 streams (1 the E.boundary).
